stratagems.type: Hammer of the Emperor – Battle Tactic Stratagem
stratagems.legend: By petitioning the machine spirits of their vehicles, tank crews push their armoured steeds beyond conventional limits.
stratagems.description:
WHEN: Your Movement phase, just after a SQUADRON unit from your army Advances.

TARGET: That SQUADRON unit.

EFFECT: Until the end of the turn, your unit is eligible to shoot in a turn in which it Advanced.

stratagems.name: FIRE AND RELOCATE
stratagems.legend: Once deployed, it is vital that the soldiers stay on the move and keep firing, avoiding becoming bogged down and maintaining the pressure on their reeling foes.
stratagems.description:
WHEN: Your Shooting phase.

TARGET: One ASTRA MILITARUM unit (excluding TITANIC units) from your army.

EFFECT: Until the end of the phase, your unit is eligible to shoot in a turn in which it Advanced.

stratagems.name: TACTICAL WITHDRAWAL
stratagems.type: Hammer of the Emperor – Strategic Ploy Stratagem
stratagems.legend: Even in retreat, the armoured fist of the Astra Militarum keep their cannons firing.
stratagems.description:
WHEN: Your Movement phase, just after a SQUADRON unit from your army Falls Back.

TARGET: That SQUADRON unit.

EFFECT: Until the end of the turn, your unit is eligible to shoot in a turn in which it Fell Back.

stratagems.name: CRASH THROUGH
stratagems.type: Hammer of the Emperor – Strategic Ploy Stratagem
stratagems.legend: Ruins, barricades, bunkers; few such structures can impede the grinding advance of an Astra Militarum armoured corps.
stratagems.description:
WHEN: Your Movement phase or your Charge phase.

TARGET: One ASTRA MILITARUM VEHICLE unit from your army that has not been selected to move or charge this phase.

EFFECT: Until the end of the phase, each time your unit makes a Normal, Advance or Charge move, it can move horizontally through terrain features as if they were not there.

stratagems.name: FURIOUS CANNONADE
stratagems.type: Hammer of the Emperor – Battle Tactic Stratagem
stratagems.legend: At close range, armoured vehicles open up with their full complement of weapons, dispensing the Emperor’s righteous wrath.
stratagems.description:
WHEN: Your Shooting phase.

TARGET: One SQUADRON unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot this phase.

EFFECT: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes an attack that targets a unit within 12", improve the Armour Penetration characteristic of that attack by 1.

stratagems.name: STALWART PROTECTOR
stratagems.legend: The indefatigable tanks of the Astra Militarum serve as mobile cover for the troops marching in their shadow.
stratagems.description:
WHEN: Your opponent’s Shooting phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.

TARGET: One ASTRA MILITARUM VEHICLE unit from your army.

EFFECT: Until the end of the phase, each time a ranged attack is allocated to an INFANTRY model from your army, if that model is not fully visible to every model in the attacking unit because of your VEHICLE, that model has the Benefit of Cover against that attack.

stratagems.name: COUNTER-OFFENSIVE
stratagems.legend: In close-quarters combat, the slightest hesitation can leave an opening for a swift foe to exploit.
stratagems.description:
WHEN: Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has fought.

TARGET: One unit from your army that is within Engagement Range of one or more enemy units and that has not already been selected to fight this phase.

EFFECT: Your unit fights next.

stratagems.name: COORDINATED ACTION
stratagems.legend: The potency of armour and infantry is greatly enhanced when both work in close concert.
stratagems.description:
WHEN: Start of any phase.

TARGET: One REGIMENT unit from your army and one SQUADRON unit from your army within 6" of and visible to that REGIMENT unit.

EFFECT: Until the end of the phase, Orders affecting one of your units affect the other, and vice versa.

stratagems.name: FIELDS OF FIRE
stratagems.legend: Armour and infantry work in concert, forming overlapping fields of fire against which neither cover nor heavy armour can protect.
stratagems.description:
WHEN: Your Shooting phase.

TARGET: One REGIMENT unit and one SQUADRON unit from your army that have not been selected to shoot this phase.

EFFECT: Select one enemy unit. Until the end of the phase, each time your selected REGIMENT and SQUADRON units make an attack that targets that enemy unit, improve the Armour Penetration characteristic of that attack by 1.

stratagems.name: COUNTER-OFFENSIVE
stratagems.legend: In close-quarters combat, the slightest hesitation can leave an opening for a swift foe to exploit.
stratagems.description:
WHEN: Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has fought.

TARGET: One unit from your army that is within Engagement Range of one or more enemy units and that has not already been selected to fight this phase.

EFFECT: Your unit fights next.

stratagems.name: INSANE BRAVERY
stratagems.legend: Indifferent to their own survival, these warriors hold their ground against seemingly impossible odds.
stratagems.description:
WHEN: Battle-shock step of your Command phase, just before you take a Battle-shock test for a unit from your army.

TARGET: That unit from your army.

EFFECT: Your unit automatically passes that Battle-shock test.

RESTRICTIONS: You cannot use this Stratagem more than once per battle.

stratagems.name: COMMAND RE-ROLL
stratagems.legend: A great commander can bend even the vagaries of fate and fortune to their will, the better to ensure victory.
stratagems.description:
WHEN: Any phase, just after you make an Advance roll, a Charge roll, a Desperate Escape test or a Hazardous test for a unit from your army, or a Hit roll, a Wound roll, a Damage roll or a saving throw for a model in that unit, or a roll to determine the number of attacks made with a weapon equipped by a model in that unit. If you are using fast dice rolling, this Stratagem can still be used after rolling multiple rolls or saving throws at once.

TARGET: That unit or model from your army.

EFFECT: You re-roll that roll, test or saving throw. If you are using fast dice rolling, select one of those rolls or saving throws to re-roll.

stratagems.name: FIRE OVERWATCH
stratagems.legend: A hail of wildfire can drive back advancing foes.
stratagems.description:
WHEN: Your opponent’s Movement or Charge phase, just after an enemy unit is set up or when an enemy unit starts or ends a Normal, Advance or Fall Back move, or declares a charge.

TARGET: One unit from your army that is within 24" of that enemy unit and that would be eligible to shoot if it were your Shooting phase.

EFFECT: If that enemy unit is visible to your unit, your unit can shoot that enemy unit as if it were your Shooting phase.

RESTRICTIONS: You cannot target a TITANIC unit with this Stratagem. Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes a ranged attack, an unmodified Hit roll of 6 is required to score a hit, irrespective of the attacking weapon’s Ballistic Skill or any modifiers. You can only use this Stratagem once per turn.

stratagems.name: INSANE BRAVERY
stratagems.legend: Indifferent to their own survival, these warriors hold their ground against seemingly impossible odds.
stratagems.description:
WHEN: Battle-shock step of your Command phase, just after you have failed a Battle-shock test taken for a unit from your army.

TARGET: The unit from your army that Battle-shock test was just taken for (even though your Battle-shocked units cannot normally be affected by your Stratagems).

EFFECT: Your unit is treated as having passed that test instead, and is not Battle-shocked as a result.

stratagems.name: EXPLOSIVE CLEARANCE
stratagems.legend: A well-placed explosive munition in confined shipboard spaces can cause bloody carnage.
stratagems.description:
WHEN: Your Shooting phase.

TARGET: One unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot this phase.

EFFECT: Select one model in your unit that is equipped with a weapon with the [BLAST] ability. Until the end of the phase, when determining how many models are in the target unit for the purpose of that ability, include models that are not visible to the attacking model. In addition, attacks made with that weapon can be allocated to models that are not visible to the attacking model.

stratagems.name: SWIFT INTERCEPTION
stratagems.legend: Fast-moving armoured transports allow a commander to react quickly to enemy movements and intercept outflanking opponents.
stratagems.description:
WHEN: Your opponent’s Movement phase, just after an enemy unit ends a Normal, Advance or Fall Back move.

TARGET: One TRANSPORT unit from your army (excluding TITANIC units) that is not within Engagement Range of one or more enemy units, and is within 9" of the enemy unit that just ended that move.

EFFECT: Your TRANSPORT can make a Normal move of up to 6".

stratagems.name: SMOKESCREEN
stratagems.legend: Even the most skilled marksmen struggle to hit targets veiled by billowing screens of smoke.
stratagems.description:
WHEN: Your opponent’s Shooting phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.

TARGET: One SMOKE unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit’s attacks.

EFFECT: Until the end of the phase, all models in your unit have the Benefit of Cover and the Stealth ability.

stratagems.name: RAPID INGRESS
stratagems.legend: Be it cunning strategy, potent technology or supernatural ritual, there are many means by which a commander may hasten their warriors’ onset.
stratagems.description:
WHEN: End of your opponent’s Movement phase.

TARGET: One unit from your army that is in Reserves.

EFFECT: Your unit can arrive on the battlefield as if it were the Reinforcements step of your Movement phase, and if every model in that unit has the Deep Strike ability, you can set that unit up as described in the Deep Strike ability (even though it is not your Movement phase).

RESTRICTIONS: You cannot use this Stratagem to enable a unit to arrive on the battlefield during a battle round it would not normally be able to do so in.

stratagems.name: ABLATIVE PLATING
stratagems.type: Hammer of the Emperor – Wargear Stratagem
stratagems.legend: Crews routinely reinforce their vehicle's armour, adding ablative plating, track links, sandbags and other means to protect the hull.
stratagems.description:
WHEN: Your opponent’s Shooting phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.

TARGET: One ASTRA MILITARUM VEHICLE unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit’s attacks.

EFFECT: Until the end of the phase, each time an attack is allocated to your unit, subtract 1 from the Damage characteristic of that attack.

detachmentAbilities.name: Born Soldiers
detachmentAbilities.legend: Regiments of numerous origins and tactical roles inculcate their soldiers from an early age with the legendary doctrines of the Tactica Imperium. Infantry train in close-range fire patterns intended to decimate enemy soldiers, whilst tank crews spend countless hours practising to bring down enemy armour and rampaging monstrosities.
detachmentAbilities.description:
Each time a model in a REGIMENT unit from your army makes a ranged attack that targets a visible unit (excluding MONSTERS and VEHICLES), that attack has the [LETHAL HITS] ability.

Each time a model in a SQUADRON unit from your army makes a ranged attack that targets a visible MONSTER or VEHICLE unit, that attack has the [LETHAL HITS] ability.

detachmentAbilities.name: Iron Tread
detachmentAbilities.legend: The armoured spearhead of an Astra Militarum army group grinds relentlessly forward, ploughing through enemy infantry with arrogant disregard.
detachmentAbilities.description: Each time a SQUADRON unit from your army Advances, do not make an Advance roll for it; until the end of the phase, add 6" to the Move characteristic of models in that unit, and when making that Advance move, that unit can move within Engagement Range of enemy models but cannot end that move within Engagement Range of enemy models.

detachmentAbilities.name: Artillery Support
detachmentAbilities.legend: Artillery barrages lay the ground for the assault to come.
detachmentAbilities.description:
At the start of the battle round, select one of the following types of artillery support.
  • Creeping Barrage: Roll one D6 for each enemy unit that is more than 12" from every model from your army that is on the battlefield: On a 5+, until the end of the battle round, that unit is shaken. While a unit is shaken, subtract 2" from its Move characteristic and subtract 2 from Charge rolls made for it. The maximum number of units that can be shaken by this rule in each battle round depends on the battle size, as shown below.
  • Incendiary Bombardment: Select a number of enemy units more than 12" from every model from your army that is on the battlefield. Until the end of the battle round, those enemy units are scattered. While a unit is scattered, it cannot have the Benefit of Cover. The maximum number of units you can select in this way depends on the battle size, as shown below.
    • Smoke Shells: Select a number of units from your army. Until the end of the battle round, those units have the Stealth ability.

    BATTLE SIZEMAXIMUM NUMBER OF UNITSIncursion2Strike Force3Onslaught4

datasheets.name: Taurox
datasheets.legend: Designed to exploit gaps in the enemy battle line or plug holes torn in the Astra Militarum’s own, the Taurox is a swift armoured transport, its rugged tracks enabling it to cross difficult terrain with ease. The Taurox’s autocannons mow down the foe as it roars forward, eliminating threats to its passengers as they rapidly deploy.
datasheets.loadout: This model is equipped with: twin autocannon; armoured tracks.
datasheets.transport: This model has a transport capacity of 12 ASTRA MILITARUM INFANTRY models. Each OGRYN model takes up the space of 3 models. It cannot transport ARTILLERY models.

abilities.name: Deadly Demise
abilities.legend: From detonating ammo stores to corrosive innards or frenzied death throes, some targets are deadly even in defeat.
abilities.description:
From detonating ammo stores to corrosive innards or frenzied death throes, some targets are deadly even in defeat.Some models have ‘Deadly Demise x’ listed in their abilities. When such a model is destroyed, roll one D6 before removing it from play (if such a model is a TRANSPORT, roll before any embarked models disembark). On a 6, each unit within 6" of that model suffers a number of mortal wounds denoted by ‘x’ (if this is a random number, roll separately for each unit within 6").

Example: A TRANSPORT model with the Deadly Demise D3 ability is destroyed. Before any models disembark and before removing it from play, its controlling player rolls one D6, getting a 6. There are three units within 6" of that destroyed model, so its controlling player rolls one D3 for each of them, inflicting mortal wounds accordingly.
  • Deadly Demise x: When this model is destroyed, roll one D6. On a 6, each unit within 6" suffers ‘x’ mortal wounds.

Those few who volunteer to serve in these tanks often have a cavalier attitude, and revel in their reputation for reckless destruction.

datasheets.damagedDescription: While this model has 1-4 wounds remaining, each time this model makes an attack, subtract 1 from the Hit roll.

abilities.name: Deadly Demise
abilities.legend: From detonating ammo stores to corrosive innards or frenzied death throes, some targets are deadly even in defeat.
abilities.description:

When such a model is destroyed, roll one D6 before removing it from play (if such a model is a TRANSPORT, roll before any embarked models disembark). On a 6, each unit within 6" of that model suffers a number of mortal wounds denoted by ‘x’ (if this is a random number, roll separately for each unit within 6").

options.description:
This model’s inferno cannon can be replaced with one of the following:
  • 1 chem cannon
  • 1 melta cannon

This model’s heavy flamer can be replaced with one of the following:
  • 1 heavy bolter
  • 1 multi-melta
This model can be equipped with 1 hunter-killer missile.

stratagems.name: COMMAND RE-ROLL
stratagems.legend: A great commander can bend even the vagaries of fate and fortune to their will, the better to ensure victory.
stratagems.description:
WHEN: Any phase, just after you have made a Hit roll, a Wound roll, a Damage roll, a saving throw, an Advance roll, a Charge roll, a Desperate Escape test, a Hazardous test, or just after you have rolled the dice to determine the number of attacks made with a weapon, for an attack, model or unit from your army.

TARGET: That unit or model from your army.

EFFECT: You re-roll that roll, test or saving throw.

stratagems.name: COUNTER-OFFENSIVE
stratagems.legend: In close-quarters combat, the slightest hesitation can leave an opening for a swift foe to exploit.
stratagems.description:
WHEN: Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has fought.

TARGET: One unit from your army that is within Engagement Range of one or more enemy units and that has not already been selected to fight this phase.

EFFECT: Your unit fights next.

stratagems.name: INSANE BRAVERY
stratagems.legend: Indifferent to their own survival, these warriors hold their ground against seemingly impossible odds.
stratagems.description:
WHEN: Battle-shock step of your Command phase, just after you have failed a Battle-shock test taken for a unit from your army.

TARGET: The unit from your army that Battle-shock test was just taken for (even though your Battle-shocked units cannot normally be affected by your Stratagems).

EFFECT: Your unit is treated as having passed that test instead, and is not Battle-shocked as a result.

stratagems.name: STALWART PROTECTOR
stratagems.legend: The indefatigable tanks of the Astra Militarum serve as mobile cover for the troops marching in their shadow.
stratagems.description:
WHEN: Your opponent’s Shooting phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.

TARGET: One ASTRA MILITARUM VEHICLE unit from your army.

EFFECT: Until the end of the phase, each time a ranged attack is allocated to an INFANTRY model from your army, if that model is not fully visible to every model in the attacking unit because of your VEHICLE, that model has the Benefit of Cover against that attack.

stratagems.name: FIELDS OF FIRE
stratagems.legend: Armour and infantry work in concert, forming overlapping fields of fire against which neither cover nor heavy armour can protect.
stratagems.description:
WHEN: Your Shooting phase.

TARGET: One REGIMENT unit and one SQUADRON unit from your army that have not been selected to shoot this phase.

EFFECT: Select one enemy unit. Until the end of the phase, each time your selected REGIMENT and SQUADRON units make an attack that targets that enemy unit, improve the Armour Penetration characteristic of that attack by 1.

stratagems.name: COORDINATED ACTION
stratagems.legend: The potency of armour and infantry is greatly enhanced when both work in close concert.
stratagems.description:
WHEN: Start of any phase.

TARGET: One REGIMENT unit from your army and one SQUADRON unit from your army within 6" of and visible to that REGIMENT unit.

EFFECT: Until the end of the phase, Orders affecting one of your units affect the other, and vice versa.

stratagems.name: FURIOUS CANNONADE
stratagems.type: Hammer of the Emperor – Battle Tactic Stratagem
stratagems.legend: At close range, armoured vehicles open up with their full complement of weapons, dispensing the Emperor’s righteous wrath.
stratagems.description:
WHEN: Your Shooting phase.

TARGET: One SQUADRON unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot this phase.

EFFECT: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes an attack that targets a unit within 12", improve the Armour Penetration characteristic of that attack by 1.

stratagems.name: EXPLOSIVE CLEARANCE
stratagems.legend: A well-placed explosive munition in confined shipboard spaces can cause bloody carnage.
stratagems.description:
WHEN: Your Shooting phase.

TARGET: One unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot this phase.

EFFECT: Select one model in your unit that is equipped with a weapon with the [BLAST] ability. Until the end of the phase, when determining how many models are in the target unit for the purpose of that ability, include models that are not visible to the attacking model. In addition, attacks made with that weapon can be allocated to models that are not visible to the attacking model.

stratagems.name: TANK SHOCK
stratagems.legend: Ramming the foe with a speeding vehicle may be an unsubtle tactic, but it is a murderously effective one.
stratagems.description:
WHEN: Your Charge phase, just after a VEHICLE unit from your army ends a Charge move.

TARGET: That VEHICLE unit.

EFFECT: Select one enemy unit within Engagement Range of your unit, and select one VEHICLE model in your unit that is within Engagement Range of that enemy unit. Roll a number of D6 equal to the Toughness characteristic of the selected VEHICLE model. For each 5+, that enemy unit suffers 1 mortal wound (to a maximum of 6 mortal wounds).

stratagems.name: CRASH THROUGH
stratagems.type: Hammer of the Emperor – Strategic Ploy Stratagem
stratagems.legend: Ruins, barricades, bunkers; few such structures can impede the grinding advance of an Astra Militarum armoured corps.
stratagems.description:
WHEN: Your Movement phase or your Charge phase.

TARGET: One ASTRA MILITARUM VEHICLE unit from your army that has not been selected to move or charge this phase.

EFFECT: Until the end of the phase, each time your unit makes a Normal, Advance or Charge move, it can move horizontally through terrain features as if they were not there.

stratagems.name: RAPID INGRESS
stratagems.legend: Be it cunning strategy, potent technology or supernatural ritual, there are many means by which a commander may hasten their warriors’ onset.
stratagems.description:
WHEN: End of your opponent’s Movement phase.

TARGET: One unit from your army that is in Reserves.

EFFECT: Your unit can arrive on the battlefield as if it were the Reinforcements step of your Movement phase, and if every model in that unit has the Deep Strike ability, you can set that unit up as described in the Deep Strike ability (even though it is not your Movement phase).

RESTRICTIONS: You cannot use this Stratagem to enable a unit to arrive on the battlefield during a battle round it would not normally be able to do so in.

stratagems.name: INSANE BRAVERY
stratagems.legend: Indifferent to their own survival, these warriors hold their ground against seemingly impossible odds.
stratagems.description:
WHEN: Battle-shock step of your Command phase, just before you take a Battle-shock test for a unit from your army.

TARGET: That unit from your army.

EFFECT: Your unit automatically passes that Battle-shock test.

RESTRICTIONS: You cannot use this Stratagem more than once per battle.

stratagems.name: COUNTER-OFFENSIVE
stratagems.legend: In close-quarters combat, the slightest hesitation can leave an opening for a swift foe to exploit.
stratagems.description:
WHEN: Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has fought.

TARGET: One unit from your army that is within Engagement Range of one or more enemy units and that has not already been selected to fight this phase.

EFFECT: Your unit fights next.

stratagems.name: SMOKESCREEN
stratagems.legend: Even the most skilled marksmen struggle to hit targets veiled by billowing screens of smoke.
stratagems.description:
WHEN: Your opponent’s Shooting phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.

TARGET: One SMOKE unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit’s attacks.

EFFECT: Until the end of the phase, all models in your unit have the Benefit of Cover and the Stealth ability.

stratagems.name: COMMAND RE-ROLL
stratagems.legend: A great commander can bend even the vagaries of fate and fortune to their will, the better to ensure victory.
stratagems.description:
WHEN: Any phase, just after you make an Advance roll, a Charge roll, a Desperate Escape test or a Hazardous test for a unit from your army, or a Hit roll, a Wound roll, a Damage roll or a saving throw for a model in that unit, or a roll to determine the number of attacks made with a weapon equipped by a model in that unit. If you are using fast dice rolling, this Stratagem can still be used after rolling multiple rolls or saving throws at once.

TARGET: That unit or model from your army.

EFFECT: You re-roll that roll, test or saving throw. If you are using fast dice rolling, select one of those rolls or saving throws to re-roll.

stratagems.name: ABLATIVE PLATING
stratagems.type: Hammer of the Emperor – Wargear Stratagem
stratagems.legend: Crews routinely reinforce their vehicle's armour, adding ablative plating, track links, sandbags and other means to protect the hull.
stratagems.description:
WHEN: Your opponent’s Shooting phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.

TARGET: One ASTRA MILITARUM VEHICLE unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit’s attacks.

EFFECT: Until the end of the phase, each time an attack is allocated to your unit, subtract 1 from the Damage characteristic of that attack.

stratagems.name: FIRE OVERWATCH
stratagems.legend: A hail of wildfire can drive back advancing foes.
stratagems.description:
WHEN: Your opponent’s Movement or Charge phase, just after an enemy unit is set up or when an enemy unit starts or ends a Normal, Advance or Fall Back move, or declares a charge.

TARGET: One unit from your army that is within 24" of that enemy unit and that would be eligible to shoot if it were your Shooting phase.

EFFECT: If that enemy unit is visible to your unit, your unit can shoot that enemy unit as if it were your Shooting phase.

RESTRICTIONS: You cannot target a TITANIC unit with this Stratagem. Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes a ranged attack, an unmodified Hit roll of 6 is required to score a hit, irrespective of the attacking weapon’s Ballistic Skill or any modifiers. You can only use this Stratagem once per turn.

stratagems.name: BLAZING ADVANCE
stratagems.type: Hammer of the Emperor – Battle Tactic Stratagem
stratagems.legend: By petitioning the machine spirits of their vehicles, tank crews push their armoured steeds beyond conventional limits.
stratagems.description:
WHEN: Your Movement phase, just after a SQUADRON unit from your army Advances.

TARGET: That SQUADRON unit.

EFFECT: Until the end of the turn, your unit is eligible to shoot in a turn in which it Advanced.

stratagems.name: FINAL HOUR
stratagems.type: Hammer of the Emperor – Epic Deed Stratagem
stratagems.legend: Even with flames licking through the interior of their vehicle, this crew refuse to abandon their positions, regardless of the risk to their lives.
stratagems.description:
WHEN: Your Command phase.

TARGET: One SQUADRON unit from your army that is Below Half-strength (excluding OFFICER units).

EFFECT: Until the end of the battle round, ranged weapons equipped by models in your unit (excluding [ONE SHOT] weapons) have the [HAZARDOUS] ability, and each time a model in your unit makes a ranged attack, you can ignore any or all modifiers to that attack’s Ballistic Skill characteristic and to the Hit roll.

stratagems.name: FIRE AND RELOCATE
stratagems.legend: Once deployed, it is vital that the soldiers stay on the move and keep firing, avoiding becoming bogged down and maintaining the pressure on their reeling foes.
stratagems.description:
WHEN: Your Shooting phase.

TARGET: One ASTRA MILITARUM unit (excluding TITANIC units) from your army.

EFFECT: Until the end of the phase, your unit is eligible to shoot in a turn in which it Advanced.

stratagems.name: TACTICAL WITHDRAWAL
stratagems.type: Hammer of the Emperor – Strategic Ploy Stratagem
stratagems.legend: Even in retreat, the armoured fist of the Astra Militarum keep their cannons firing.
stratagems.description:
WHEN: Your Movement phase, just after a SQUADRON unit from your army Falls Back.

TARGET: That SQUADRON unit.

EFFECT: Until the end of the turn, your unit is eligible to shoot in a turn in which it Fell Back.

detachmentAbilities.name: Artillery Support
detachmentAbilities.legend: Artillery barrages lay the ground for the assault to come.
detachmentAbilities.description:
At the start of the battle round, select one of the following types of artillery support.
  • Creeping Barrage: Roll one D6 for each enemy unit that is more than 12" from every model from your army that is on the battlefield: On a 5+, until the end of the battle round, that unit is shaken. While a unit is shaken, subtract 2" from its Move characteristic and subtract 2 from Charge rolls made for it. The maximum number of units that can be shaken by this rule in each battle round depends on the battle size, as shown below.
  • Incendiary Bombardment: Select a number of enemy units more than 12" from every model from your army that is on the battlefield. Until the end of the battle round, those enemy units are scattered. While a unit is scattered, it cannot have the Benefit of Cover. The maximum number of units you can select in this way depends on the battle size, as shown below.
    • Smoke Shells: Select a number of units from your army. Until the end of the battle round, those units have the Stealth ability.

    BATTLE SIZEMAXIMUM NUMBER OF UNITSIncursion2Strike Force3Onslaught4

detachmentAbilities.name: Born Soldiers
detachmentAbilities.legend: Regiments of numerous origins and tactical roles inculcate their soldiers from an early age with the legendary doctrines of the Tactica Imperium. Infantry train in close-range fire patterns intended to decimate enemy soldiers, whilst tank crews spend countless hours practising to bring down enemy armour and rampaging monstrosities.
detachmentAbilities.description:
Each time a model in a REGIMENT unit from your army makes a ranged attack that targets a visible unit (excluding MONSTERS and VEHICLES), that attack has the [LETHAL HITS] ability.

Each time a model in a SQUADRON unit from your army makes a ranged attack that targets a visible MONSTER or VEHICLE unit, that attack has the [LETHAL HITS] ability.

detachmentAbilities.name: Iron Tread
detachmentAbilities.legend: The armoured spearhead of an Astra Militarum army group grinds relentlessly forward, ploughing through enemy infantry with arrogant disregard.
detachmentAbilities.description: Each time a SQUADRON unit from your army Advances, do not make an Advance roll for it; until the end of the phase, add 6" to the Move characteristic of models in that unit, and when making that Advance move, that unit can move within Engagement Range of enemy models but cannot end that move within Engagement Range of enemy models.

datasheets.name: Basilisk
datasheets.legend: Basilisks are self-propelled artillery tanks, armed with a fearsome earthshaker cannon. Able to keep pace with infantry advances – their barrels levelled for direct fire – or deploy to rear positions from which they unleash relentless shelling, Basilisks are amongst the most numerous of the Imperial Guard’s ordnance tanks.
datasheets.loadout: This model is equipped with: earthshaker cannon; heavy bolter; armoured tracks.
datasheets.damagedDescription: While this model has 1-4 wounds remaining, each time this model makes an attack, subtract 1 from the Hit roll.

EFFECT: Your unit fights next.

detachmentAbilities.name: Iron Tread
detachmentAbilities.legend: The armoured spearhead of an Astra Militarum army group grinds relentlessly forward, ploughing through enemy infantry with arrogant disregard.
detachmentAbilities.description: Each time a SQUADRON unit from your army Advances, do not make an Advance roll for it; until the end of the phase, add 6" to the Move characteristic of models in that unit, and when making that Advance move, that unit can move within Engagement Range of enemy models but cannot end that move within Engagement Range of enemy models.

detachmentAbilities.name: Artillery Support
detachmentAbilities.legend: Artillery barrages lay the ground for the assault to come.
detachmentAbilities.description:
At the start of the battle round, select one of the following types of artillery support.
  • Creeping Barrage: Roll one D6 for each enemy unit that is more than 12" from every model from your army that is on the battlefield: On a 5+, until the end of the battle round, that unit is shaken. While a unit is shaken, subtract 2" from its Move characteristic and subtract 2 from Charge rolls made for it. The maximum number of units that can be shaken by this rule in each battle round depends on the battle size, as shown below.
  • Incendiary Bombardment: Select a number of enemy units more than 12" from every model from your army that is on the battlefield. Until the end of the battle round, those enemy units are scattered. While a unit is scattered, it cannot have the Benefit of Cover. The maximum number of units you can select in this way depends on the battle size, as shown below.
    • Smoke Shells: Select a number of units from your army. Until the end of the battle round, those units have the Stealth ability.

detachmentAbilities.name: Born Soldiers
detachmentAbilities.legend: Regiments of numerous origins and tactical roles inculcate their soldiers from an early age with the legendary doctrines of the Tactica Imperium. Infantry train in close-range fire patterns intended to decimate enemy soldiers, whilst tank crews spend countless hours practising to bring down enemy armour and rampaging monstrosities.
detachmentAbilities.description:
Each time a model in a REGIMENT unit from your army makes a ranged attack that targets a visible unit (excluding MONSTERS and VEHICLES), that attack has the [LETHAL HITS] ability.

Each time a model in a SQUADRON unit from your army makes a ranged attack that targets a visible MONSTER or VEHICLE unit, that attack has the [LETHAL HITS] ability.

datasheets.name: Hydra
datasheets.legend: A primary anti-aircraft asset, the Hydra is a flak tank equipped with an array of specially adapted autocannons. As many allied tanks are vulnerable from the air, the Hydra is highly valuable. Once it locks on to enemy aircraft, even the most evasive targets cannot escape its storm of shells.
datasheets.loadout: This model is equipped with: heavy bolter; Hydra autocannon; armoured tracks.
datasheets.damagedDescription: While this model has 1-4 wounds remaining, each time this model makes an attack, subtract 1 from the Hit roll.

abilities.name: Deadly Demise
abilities.legend: From detonating ammo stores to corrosive innards or frenzied death throes, some targets are deadly even in defeat.
abilities.description:
From detonating ammo stores to corrosive innards or frenzied death throes, some targets are deadly even in defeat.Some models have ‘Deadly Demise x’ listed in their abilities. When such a model is destroyed, roll one D6 before removing it from play (if such a model is a TRANSPORT, roll before any embarked models disembark). On a 6, each unit within 6" of that model suffers a number of mortal wounds denoted by ‘x’ (if this is a random number, roll separately for each unit within 6").

There are three units within 6" of that destroyed model, so its controlling player rolls one D3 for each of them, inflicting mortal wounds accordingly.
  • Deadly Demise x: When this model is destroyed, roll one D6. On a 6, each unit within 6" suffers ‘x’ mortal wounds.

This model can be equipped with 1 hunter-killer missile.

stratagems.name: STALWART PROTECTOR
stratagems.legend: The indefatigable tanks of the Astra Militarum serve as mobile cover for the troops marching in their shadow.
stratagems.description:
WHEN: Your opponent’s Shooting phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.

TARGET: One ASTRA MILITARUM VEHICLE unit from your army.

EFFECT: Until the end of the phase, each time a ranged attack is allocated to an INFANTRY model from your army, if that model is not fully visible to every model in the attacking unit because of your VEHICLE, that model has the Benefit of Cover against that attack.

stratagems.name: FIRE AND RELOCATE
stratagems.legend: Once deployed, it is vital that the soldiers stay on the move and keep firing, avoiding becoming bogged down and maintaining the pressure on their reeling foes.
stratagems.description:
WHEN: Your Shooting phase.

TARGET: One ASTRA MILITARUM unit (excluding TITANIC units) from your army.

EFFECT: Until the end of the phase, your unit is eligible to shoot in a turn in which it Advanced.

stratagems.name: FINAL HOUR
stratagems.type: Hammer of the Emperor – Epic Deed Stratagem
stratagems.legend: Even with flames licking through the interior of their vehicle, this crew refuse to abandon their positions, regardless of the risk to their lives.
stratagems.description:
WHEN: Your Command phase.

TARGET: One SQUADRON unit from your army that is Below Half-strength (excluding OFFICER units).

EFFECT: Until the end of the battle round, ranged weapons equipped by models in your unit (excluding [ONE SHOT] weapons) have the [HAZARDOUS] ability, and each time a model in your unit makes a ranged attack, you can ignore any or all modifiers to that attack’s Ballistic Skill characteristic and to the Hit roll.

stratagems.name: BLAZING ADVANCE
stratagems.type: Hammer of the Emperor – Battle Tactic Stratagem
stratagems.legend: By petitioning the machine spirits of their vehicles, tank crews push their armoured steeds beyond conventional limits.
stratagems.description:
WHEN: Your Movement phase, just after a SQUADRON unit from your army Advances.

TARGET: That SQUADRON unit.

EFFECT: Until the end of the turn, your unit is eligible to shoot in a turn in which it Advanced.

stratagems.name: TACTICAL WITHDRAWAL
stratagems.type: Hammer of the Emperor – Strategic Ploy Stratagem
stratagems.legend: Even in retreat, the armoured fist of the Astra Militarum keep their cannons firing.
stratagems.description:
WHEN: Your Movement phase, just after a SQUADRON unit from your army Falls Back.

TARGET: That SQUADRON unit.

EFFECT: Until the end of the turn, your unit is eligible to shoot in a turn in which it Fell Back.

stratagems.name: CRASH THROUGH
stratagems.type: Hammer of the Emperor – Strategic Ploy Stratagem
stratagems.legend: Ruins, barricades, bunkers; few such structures can impede the grinding advance of an Astra Militarum armoured corps.
stratagems.description:
WHEN: Your Movement phase or your Charge phase.

TARGET: One ASTRA MILITARUM VEHICLE unit from your army that has not been selected to move or charge this phase.

EFFECT: Until the end of the phase, each time your unit makes a Normal, Advance or Charge move, it can move horizontally through terrain features as if they were not there.

stratagems.name: FURIOUS CANNONADE
stratagems.type: Hammer of the Emperor – Battle Tactic Stratagem
stratagems.legend: At close range, armoured vehicles open up with their full complement of weapons, dispensing the Emperor’s righteous wrath.
stratagems.description:
WHEN: Your Shooting phase.

TARGET: One SQUADRON unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot this phase.

EFFECT: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes an attack that targets a unit within 12", improve the Armour Penetration characteristic of that attack by 1.

stratagems.name: COMMAND RE-ROLL
stratagems.legend: A great commander can bend even the vagaries of fate and fortune to their will, the better to ensure victory.
stratagems.description:
WHEN: Any phase, just after you have made a Hit roll, a Wound roll, a Damage roll, a saving throw, an Advance roll, a Charge roll, a Desperate Escape test, a Hazardous test, or just after you have rolled the dice to determine the number of attacks made with a weapon, for an attack, model or unit from your army.

TARGET: That unit or model from your army.

EFFECT: You re-roll that roll, test or saving throw.

stratagems.name: COUNTER-OFFENSIVE
stratagems.legend: In close-quarters combat, the slightest hesitation can leave an opening for a swift foe to exploit.
stratagems.description:
WHEN: Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has fought.

TARGET: One unit from your army that is within Engagement Range of one or more enemy units and that has not already been selected to fight this phase.

EFFECT: Your unit fights next.

stratagems.name: INSANE BRAVERY
stratagems.legend: Indifferent to their own survival, these warriors hold their ground against seemingly impossible odds.
stratagems.description:
WHEN: Battle-shock step of your Command phase, just after you have failed a Battle-shock test taken for a unit from your army.

TARGET: The unit from your army that Battle-shock test was just taken for (even though your Battle-shocked units cannot normally be affected by your Stratagems).

EFFECT: Your unit is treated as having passed that test instead, and is not Battle-shocked as a result.

stratagems.name: COMMAND RE-ROLL
stratagems.legend: A great commander can bend even the vagaries of fate and fortune to their will, the better to ensure victory.
stratagems.description:
WHEN: Any phase, just after you make an Advance roll, a Charge roll, a Desperate Escape test or a Hazardous test for a unit from your army, or a Hit roll, a Wound roll, a Damage roll or a saving throw for a model in that unit, or a roll to determine the number of attacks made with a weapon equipped by a model in that unit. If you are using fast dice rolling, this Stratagem can still be used after rolling multiple rolls or saving throws at once.

TARGET: That unit or model from your army.

EFFECT: You re-roll that roll, test or saving throw. If you are using fast dice rolling, select one of those rolls or saving throws to re-roll.

stratagems.name: EXPLOSIVE CLEARANCE
stratagems.legend: A well-placed explosive munition in confined shipboard spaces can cause bloody carnage.
stratagems.description:
WHEN: Your Shooting phase.

TARGET: One unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot this phase.

EFFECT: Select one model in your unit that is equipped with a weapon with the [BLAST] ability. Until the end of the phase, when determining how many models are in the target unit for the purpose of that ability, include models that are not visible to the attacking model. In addition, attacks made with that weapon can be allocated to models that are not visible to the attacking model.

stratagems.name: SMOKESCREEN
stratagems.legend: Even the most skilled marksmen struggle to hit targets veiled by billowing screens of smoke.
stratagems.description:
WHEN: Your opponent’s Shooting phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.

TARGET: One SMOKE unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit’s attacks.

EFFECT: Until the end of the phase, all models in your unit have the Benefit of Cover and the Stealth ability.

stratagems.name: ABLATIVE PLATING
stratagems.type: Hammer of the Emperor – Wargear Stratagem
stratagems.legend: Crews routinely reinforce their vehicle's armour, adding ablative plating, track links, sandbags and other means to protect the hull.
stratagems.description:
WHEN: Your opponent’s Shooting phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.

TARGET: One ASTRA MILITARUM VEHICLE unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit’s attacks.

EFFECT: Until the end of the phase, each time an attack is allocated to your unit, subtract 1 from the Damage characteristic of that attack.

stratagems.name: FIRE OVERWATCH
stratagems.legend: A hail of wildfire can drive back advancing foes.
stratagems.description:
WHEN: Your opponent’s Movement or Charge phase, just after an enemy unit is set up or when an enemy unit starts or ends a Normal, Advance or Fall Back move, or declares a charge.

TARGET: One unit from your army that is within 24" of that enemy unit and that would be eligible to shoot if it were your Shooting phase.

EFFECT: If that enemy unit is visible to your unit, your unit can shoot that enemy unit as if it were your Shooting phase.

RESTRICTIONS: You cannot target a TITANIC unit with this Stratagem. Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes a ranged attack, an unmodified Hit roll of 6 is required to score a hit, irrespective of the attacking weapon’s Ballistic Skill or any modifiers. You can only use this Stratagem once per turn.

stratagems.name: RAPID INGRESS
stratagems.legend: Be it cunning strategy, potent technology or supernatural ritual, there are many means by which a commander may hasten their warriors’ onset.
stratagems.description:
WHEN: End of your opponent’s Movement phase.

TARGET: One unit from your army that is in Reserves.

EFFECT: Your unit can arrive on the battlefield as if it were the Reinforcements step of your Movement phase, and if every model in that unit has the Deep Strike ability, you can set that unit up as described in the Deep Strike ability (even though it is not your Movement phase).

RESTRICTIONS: You cannot use this Stratagem to enable a unit to arrive on the battlefield during a battle round it would not normally be able to do so in.

stratagems.name: INSANE BRAVERY
stratagems.legend: Indifferent to their own survival, these warriors hold their ground against seemingly impossible odds.
stratagems.description:
WHEN: Battle-shock step of your Command phase, just before you take a Battle-shock test for a unit from your army.

TARGET: That unit from your army.

EFFECT: Your unit automatically passes that Battle-shock test.

RESTRICTIONS: You cannot use this Stratagem more than once per battle.

stratagems.name: COUNTER-OFFENSIVE
stratagems.legend: In close-quarters combat, the slightest hesitation can leave an opening for a swift foe to exploit.
stratagems.description:
WHEN: Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has fought.

TARGET: One unit from your army that is within Engagement Range of one or more enemy units and that has not already been selected to fight this phase.

EFFECT: Your unit fights next.

stratagems.name: COORDINATED ACTION
stratagems.legend: The potency of armour and infantry is greatly enhanced when both work in close concert.
stratagems.description:
WHEN: Start of any phase.

TARGET: One REGIMENT unit from your army and one SQUADRON unit from your army within 6" of and visible to that REGIMENT unit.

EFFECT: Until the end of the phase, Orders affecting one of your units affect the other, and vice versa.

stratagems.name: TANK SHOCK
stratagems.legend: Ramming the foe with a speeding vehicle may be an unsubtle tactic, but it is a murderously effective one.
stratagems.description:
WHEN: Your Charge phase, just after a VEHICLE unit from your army ends a Charge move.

TARGET: That VEHICLE unit.

EFFECT: Select one enemy unit within Engagement Range of your unit, and select one VEHICLE model in your unit that is within Engagement Range of that enemy unit. Roll a number of D6 equal to the Toughness characteristic of the selected VEHICLE model. For each 5+, that enemy unit suffers 1 mortal wound (to a maximum of 6 mortal wounds).

stratagems.name: FIELDS OF FIRE
stratagems.legend: Armour and infantry work in concert, forming overlapping fields of fire against which neither cover nor heavy armour can protect.
stratagems.description:
WHEN: Your Shooting phase.

TARGET: One REGIMENT unit and one SQUADRON unit from your army that have not been selected to shoot this phase.

EFFECT: Select one enemy unit. Until the end of the phase, each time your selected REGIMENT and SQUADRON units make an attack that targets that enemy unit, improve the Armour Penetration characteristic of that attack by 1.

datasheets.legend: The Wyvern excels in claustrophobic urban combat, raining curtains of shells down upon luckless enemy infantry without needing to expose itself to harm. TARGET: One unit from your army that is within 24" of that enemy unit and that would be eligible to shoot if it were your Shooting phase.

EFFECT: If that enemy unit is visible to your unit, your unit can shoot that enemy unit as if it were your Shooting phase.

RESTRICTIONS: You cannot target a TITANIC unit with this Stratagem. Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes a ranged attack, an unmodified Hit roll of 6 is required to score a hit, irrespective of the attacking weapon’s Ballistic Skill or any modifiers. You can only use this Stratagem once per turn.

stratagems.name: INSANE BRAVERY
stratagems.legend: Indifferent to their own survival, these warriors hold their ground against seemingly impossible odds.
stratagems.description:
WHEN: Battle-shock step of your Command phase, just before you take a Battle-shock test for a unit from your army.

TARGET: That unit from your army.

EFFECT: Your unit automatically passes that Battle-shock test.

RESTRICTIONS: You cannot use this Stratagem more than once per battle.

stratagems.name: SMOKESCREEN
stratagems.legend: Even the most skilled marksmen struggle to hit targets veiled by billowing screens of smoke.
stratagems.description:
WHEN: Your opponent’s Shooting phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.

TARGET: One SMOKE unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit’s attacks.

EFFECT: Until the end of the phase, all models in your unit have the Benefit of Cover and the Stealth ability.

stratagems.name: STALWART PROTECTOR
stratagems.legend: The indefatigable tanks of the Astra Militarum serve as mobile cover for the troops marching in their shadow.
stratagems.description:
WHEN: Your opponent’s Shooting phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.

TARGET: One ASTRA MILITARUM VEHICLE unit from your army.

EFFECT: Until the end of the phase, each time a ranged attack is allocated to an INFANTRY model from your army, if that model is not fully visible to every model in the attacking unit because of your VEHICLE, that model has the Benefit of Cover against that attack.

stratagems.name: TANK SHOCK
stratagems.legend: Ramming the foe with a speeding vehicle may be an unsubtle tactic, but it is a murderously effective one.
stratagems.description:
WHEN: Your Charge phase, just after a VEHICLE unit from your army ends a Charge move.

TARGET: That VEHICLE unit.

EFFECT: Select one enemy unit within Engagement Range of your unit, and select one VEHICLE model in your unit that is within Engagement Range of that enemy unit. Roll a number of D6 equal to the Toughness characteristic of the selected VEHICLE model. For each 5+, that enemy unit suffers 1 mortal wound (to a maximum of 6 mortal wounds).

detachmentAbilities.name: Born Soldiers
detachmentAbilities.legend: Regiments of numerous origins and tactical roles inculcate their soldiers from an early age with the legendary doctrines of the Tactica Imperium. Infantry train in close-range fire patterns intended to decimate enemy soldiers, whilst tank crews spend countless hours practising to bring down enemy armour and rampaging monstrosities.
detachmentAbilities.description:
Each time a model in a REGIMENT unit from your army makes a ranged attack that targets a visible unit (excluding MONSTERS and VEHICLES), that attack has the [LETHAL HITS] ability.

Each time a model in a SQUADRON unit from your army makes a ranged attack that targets a visible MONSTER or VEHICLE unit, that attack has the [LETHAL HITS] ability.

detachmentAbilities.name: Artillery Support
detachmentAbilities.legend: Artillery barrages lay the ground for the assault to come.
detachmentAbilities.description:
At the start of the battle round, select one of the following types of artillery support.
  • Creeping Barrage: Roll one D6 for each enemy unit that is more than 12" from every model from your army that is on the battlefield: On a 5+, until the end of the battle round, that unit is shaken. While a unit is shaken, subtract 2" from its Move characteristic and subtract 2 from Charge rolls made for it. The maximum number of units that can be shaken by this rule in each battle round depends on the battle size, as shown below.
  • Incendiary Bombardment: Select a number of enemy units more than 12" from every model from your army that is on the battlefield. Until the end of the battle round, those enemy units are scattered. While a unit is scattered, it cannot have the Benefit of Cover. The maximum number of units you can select in this way depends on the battle size, as shown below.
    • Smoke Shells: Select a number of units from your army. Until the end of the battle round, those units have the Stealth ability.

    BATTLE SIZEMAXIMUM NUMBER OF UNITSIncursion2Strike Force3Onslaught4

detachmentAbilities.name: Iron Tread
detachmentAbilities.legend: The armoured spearhead of an Astra Militarum army group grinds relentlessly forward, ploughing through enemy infantry with arrogant disregard.
detachmentAbilities.description: Each time a SQUADRON unit from your army Advances, do not make an Advance roll for it; until the end of the phase, add 6" to the Move characteristic of models in that unit, and when making that Advance move, that unit can move within Engagement Range of enemy models but cannot end that move within Engagement Range of enemy models.

datasheets.name: Manticore
datasheets.legend: Capable of firing its limited supply of storm eagle rockets to unleash furious barrages at incredible distances, the Manticore can lay waste to enemy formations. Multiple warheads release a moment before each rocket’s impact, signalling the panicking foe’s doom no matter how far they try to flee at the last moment.
datasheets.loadout: This model is equipped with: heavy bolter; storm eagle rockets; armoured tracks.
datasheets.damagedDescription: While this model has 1-4 wounds remaining, each time this model makes an attack, subtract 1 from the Hit roll.

abilities.name: Deadly Demise
abilities.legend: From detonating ammo stores to corrosive innards or frenzied death throes, some targets are deadly even in defeat.
abilities.description:
From detonating ammo stores to corrosive innards or frenzied death throes, some targets are deadly even in defeat.Some models have ‘Deadly Demise x’ listed in their abilities. When such a model is destroyed, roll one D6 before removing it from play (if such a model is a TRANSPORT, roll before any embarked models disembark). On a 6, each unit within 6" of that model suffers a number of mortal wounds denoted by ‘x’ (if this is a random number, roll separately for each unit within 6").

Example: A TRANSPORT model with the Deadly Demise D3 ability is destroyed. Before any models disembark and before removing it from play, its controlling player rolls one D6, getting a 6. There are three units within 6" of that destroyed model, so its controlling player rolls one D3 for each of them, inflicting mortal wounds accordingly.
  • Deadly Demise x: When this model is destroyed, roll one D6. On a 6, each unit within 6" suffers ‘x’ mortal wounds.

This model can be equipped with 1 hunter-killer missile.

stratagems.name: COMMAND RE-ROLL
stratagems.legend: A great commander can bend even the vagaries of fate and fortune to their will, the better to ensure victory.
stratagems.description:
WHEN: Any phase, just after you make an Advance roll, a Charge roll, a Desperate Escape test or a Hazardous test for a unit from your army, or a Hit roll, a Wound roll, a Damage roll or a saving throw for a model in that unit, or a roll to determine the number of attacks made with a weapon equipped by a model in that unit. If you are using fast dice rolling, this Stratagem can still be used after rolling multiple rolls or saving throws at once.

TARGET: That unit or model from your army.

EFFECT: You re-roll that roll, test or saving throw. If you are using fast dice rolling, select one of those rolls or saving throws to re-roll.

stratagems.name: COORDINATED ACTION
stratagems.legend: The potency of armour and infantry is greatly enhanced when both work in close concert.
stratagems.description:
WHEN: Start of any phase.

TARGET: One REGIMENT unit from your army and one SQUADRON unit from your army within 6" of and visible to that REGIMENT unit.

EFFECT: Until the end of the phase, Orders affecting one of your units affect the other, and vice versa.

stratagems.name: SMOKESCREEN
stratagems.legend: Even the most skilled marksmen struggle to hit targets veiled by billowing screens of smoke.
stratagems.description:
WHEN: Your opponent’s Shooting phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.

TARGET: One SMOKE unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit’s attacks.

EFFECT: Until the end of the phase, all models in your unit have the Benefit of Cover and the Stealth ability.

stratagems.name: RAPID INGRESS
stratagems.legend: Be it cunning strategy, potent technology or supernatural ritual, there are many means by which a commander may hasten their warriors’ onset.
stratagems.description:
WHEN: End of your opponent’s Movement phase.

TARGET: One unit from your army that is in Reserves.

EFFECT: Your unit can arrive on the battlefield as if it were the Reinforcements step of your Movement phase, and if every model in that unit has the Deep Strike ability, you can set that unit up as described in the Deep Strike ability (even though it is not your Movement phase).

RESTRICTIONS: You cannot use this Stratagem to enable a unit to arrive on the battlefield during a battle round it would not normally be able to do so in.

stratagems.name: FIRE OVERWATCH
stratagems.legend: A hail of wildfire can drive back advancing foes.
stratagems.description:
WHEN: Your opponent’s Movement or Charge phase, just after an enemy unit is set up or when an enemy unit starts or ends a Normal, Advance or Fall Back move, or declares a charge.

TARGET: One unit from your army that is within 24" of that enemy unit and that would be eligible to shoot if it were your Shooting phase.

You can only use this Stratagem once per turn.

stratagems.name: FIELDS OF FIRE
stratagems.legend: Armour and infantry work in concert, forming overlapping fields of fire against which neither cover nor heavy armour can protect.
stratagems.description:
WHEN: Your Shooting phase.

TARGET: One REGIMENT unit and one SQUADRON unit from your army that have not been selected to shoot this phase.

EFFECT: Select one enemy unit. Until the end of the phase, each time your selected REGIMENT and SQUADRON units make an attack that targets that enemy unit, improve the Armour Penetration characteristic of that attack by 1.

stratagems.name: CRASH THROUGH
stratagems.type: Hammer of the Emperor – Strategic Ploy Stratagem
stratagems.legend: Ruins, barricades, bunkers; few such structures can impede the grinding advance of an Astra Militarum armoured corps.
stratagems.description:
WHEN: Your Movement phase or your Charge phase.

TARGET: One ASTRA MILITARUM VEHICLE unit from your army that has not been selected to move or charge this phase.

EFFECT: Until the end of the phase, each time your unit makes a Normal, Advance or Charge move, it can move horizontally through terrain features as if they were not there.

stratagems.name: FURIOUS CANNONADE
stratagems.type: Hammer of the Emperor – Battle Tactic Stratagem
stratagems.legend: At close range, armoured vehicles open up with their full complement of weapons, dispensing the Emperor’s righteous wrath.
stratagems.description:
WHEN: Your Shooting phase.

TARGET: One SQUADRON unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot this phase.

EFFECT: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes an attack that targets a unit within 12", improve the Armour Penetration characteristic of that attack by 1.

stratagems.name: ABLATIVE PLATING
stratagems.type: Hammer of the Emperor – Wargear Stratagem
stratagems.legend: Crews routinely reinforce their vehicle's armour, adding ablative plating, track links, sandbags and other means to protect the hull.
stratagems.description:
WHEN: Your opponent’s Shooting phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.

TARGET: One ASTRA MILITARUM VEHICLE unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit’s attacks.

EFFECT: Until the end of the phase, each time an attack is allocated to your unit, subtract 1 from the Damage characteristic of that attack.

stratagems.name: COMMAND RE-ROLL
stratagems.legend: A great commander can bend even the vagaries of fate and fortune to their will, the better to ensure victory.
stratagems.description:
WHEN: Any phase, just after you have made a Hit roll, a Wound roll, a Damage roll, a saving throw, an Advance roll, a Charge roll, a Desperate Escape test, a Hazardous test, or just after you have rolled the dice to determine the number of attacks made with a weapon, for an attack, model or unit from your army.

TARGET: That unit or model from your army.

EFFECT: You re-roll that roll, test or saving throw.

stratagems.name: FINAL HOUR
stratagems.type: Hammer of the Emperor – Epic Deed Stratagem
stratagems.legend: Even with flames licking through the interior of their vehicle, this crew refuse to abandon their positions, regardless of the risk to their lives.
stratagems.description:
WHEN: Your Command phase.

TARGET: One SQUADRON unit from your army that is Below Half-strength (excluding OFFICER units).

EFFECT: Until the end of the battle round, ranged weapons equipped by models in your unit (excluding [ONE SHOT] weapons) have the [HAZARDOUS] ability, and each time a model in your unit makes a ranged attack, you can ignore any or all modifiers to that attack’s Ballistic Skill characteristic and to the Hit roll.

stratagems.name: COUNTER-OFFENSIVE
stratagems.legend: In close-quarters combat, the slightest hesitation can leave an opening for a swift foe to exploit.
stratagems.description:
WHEN: Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has fought.

TARGET: One unit from your army that is within Engagement Range of one or more enemy units and that has not already been selected to fight this phase.

EFFECT: Your unit fights next.

stratagems.name: INSANE BRAVERY
stratagems.legend: Indifferent to their own survival, these warriors hold their ground against seemingly impossible odds.
stratagems.description:
WHEN: Battle-shock step of your Command phase, just after you have failed a Battle-shock test taken for a unit from your army.

TARGET: The unit from your army that Battle-shock test was just taken for (even though your Battle-shocked units cannot normally be affected by your Stratagems).

EFFECT: Your unit is treated as having passed that test instead, and is not Battle-shocked as a result.

stratagems.name: EXPLOSIVE CLEARANCE
stratagems.legend: A well-placed explosive munition in confined shipboard spaces can cause bloody carnage.
stratagems.description:
WHEN: Your Shooting phase.

TARGET: One unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot this phase.

EFFECT: Select one model in your unit that is equipped with a weapon with the [BLAST] ability. Until the end of the phase, when determining how many models are in the target unit for the purpose of that ability, include models that are not visible to the attacking model. In addition, attacks made with that weapon can be allocated to models that are not visible to the attacking model.

WHEN: Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has fought.

TARGET: One unit from your army that is within Engagement Range of one or more enemy units and that has not already been selected to fight this phase.

EFFECT: Your unit fights next.

stratagems.name: BLAZING ADVANCE
stratagems.type: Hammer of the Emperor – Battle Tactic Stratagem
stratagems.legend: By petitioning the machine spirits of their vehicles, tank crews push their armoured steeds beyond conventional limits.
stratagems.description:
WHEN: Your Movement phase, just after a SQUADRON unit from your army Advances.

TARGET: That SQUADRON unit.

EFFECT: Until the end of the turn, your unit is eligible to shoot in a turn in which it Advanced.

stratagems.name: FIRE AND RELOCATE
stratagems.legend: Once deployed, it is vital that the soldiers stay on the move and keep firing, avoiding becoming bogged down and maintaining the pressure on their reeling foes.
stratagems.description:
WHEN: Your Shooting phase.

TARGET: One ASTRA MILITARUM unit (excluding TITANIC units) from your army.

EFFECT: Until the end of the phase, your unit is eligible to shoot in a turn in which it Advanced.

stratagems.name: TACTICAL WITHDRAWAL
stratagems.type: Hammer of the Emperor – Strategic Ploy Stratagem
stratagems.legend: Even in retreat, the armoured fist of the Astra Militarum keep their cannons firing.
stratagems.description:
WHEN: Your Movement phase, just after a SQUADRON unit from your army Falls Back.

TARGET: That SQUADRON unit.

EFFECT: Until the end of the turn, your unit is eligible to shoot in a turn in which it Fell Back.

stratagems.legend: Ramming the foe with a speeding vehicle may be an unsubtle tactic, but it is a murderously effective one.

TARGET: One SQUADRON unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot this phase.

EFFECT: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes an attack that targets a unit within 12", improve the Armour Penetration characteristic of that attack by 1.

stratagems.name: RAPID INGRESS
stratagems.legend: Be it cunning strategy, potent technology or supernatural ritual, there are many means by which a commander may hasten their warriors’ onset.
stratagems.description:
WHEN: End of your opponent’s Movement phase.

TARGET: One unit from your army that is in Reserves.

EFFECT: Your unit can arrive on the battlefield as if it were the Reinforcements step of your Movement phase, and if every model in that unit has the Deep Strike ability, you can set that unit up as described in the Deep Strike ability (even though it is not your Movement phase).

RESTRICTIONS: You cannot use this Stratagem to enable a unit to arrive on the battlefield during a battle round it would not normally be able to do so in.

stratagems.name: CRASH THROUGH
stratagems.type: Hammer of the Emperor – Strategic Ploy Stratagem
stratagems.legend: Ruins, barricades, bunkers; few such structures can impede the grinding advance of an Astra Militarum armoured corps.
stratagems.description:
WHEN: Your Movement phase or your Charge phase.

TARGET: One ASTRA MILITARUM VEHICLE unit from your army that has not been selected to move or charge this phase.

EFFECT: Until the end of the phase, each time your unit makes a Normal, Advance or Charge move, it can move horizontally through terrain features as if they were not there.

stratagems.name: TACTICAL WITHDRAWAL
stratagems.type: Hammer of the Emperor – Strategic Ploy Stratagem
stratagems.legend: Even in retreat, the armoured fist of the Astra Militarum keep their cannons firing.
stratagems.description:
WHEN: Your Movement phase, just after a SQUADRON unit from your army Falls Back.

TARGET: That SQUADRON unit.

EFFECT: Until the end of the turn, your unit is eligible to shoot in a turn in which it Fell Back.

stratagems.name: BLAZING ADVANCE
stratagems.type: Hammer of the Emperor – Battle Tactic Stratagem
stratagems.legend: By petitioning the machine spirits of their vehicles, tank crews push their armoured steeds beyond conventional limits.
stratagems.description:
WHEN: Your Movement phase, just after a SQUADRON unit from your army Advances.

TARGET: That SQUADRON unit.

EFFECT: Until the end of the turn, your unit is eligible to shoot in a turn in which it Advanced.

stratagems.name: FINAL HOUR
stratagems.type: Hammer of the Emperor – Epic Deed Stratagem
stratagems.legend: Even with flames licking through the interior of their vehicle, this crew refuse to abandon their positions, regardless of the risk to their lives.
stratagems.description:
WHEN: Your Command phase.

TARGET: One SQUADRON unit from your army that is Below Half-strength (excluding OFFICER units).

EFFECT: Until the end of the battle round, ranged weapons equipped by models in your unit (excluding [ONE SHOT] weapons) have the [HAZARDOUS] ability, and each time a model in your unit makes a ranged attack, you can ignore any or all modifiers to that attack’s Ballistic Skill characteristic and to the Hit roll.

stratagems.name: FIRE AND RELOCATE
stratagems.legend: Once deployed, it is vital that the soldiers stay on the move and keep firing, avoiding becoming bogged down and maintaining the pressure on their reeling foes.
stratagems.description:
WHEN: Your Shooting phase.

TARGET: One ASTRA MILITARUM unit (excluding TITANIC units) from your army.

EFFECT: Until the end of the phase, your unit is eligible to shoot in a turn in which it Advanced.

stratagems.name: TANK SHOCK
stratagems.legend: Ramming the foe with a speeding vehicle may be an unsubtle tactic, but it is a murderously effective one.
stratagems.description:
WHEN: Your Charge phase, just after a VEHICLE unit from your army ends a Charge move.

TARGET: That VEHICLE unit.

EFFECT: Select one enemy unit within Engagement Range of your unit, and select one VEHICLE model in your unit that is within Engagement Range of that enemy unit. Roll a number of D6 equal to the Toughness characteristic of the selected VEHICLE model. For each 5+, that enemy unit suffers 1 mortal wound (to a maximum of 6 mortal wounds).

stratagems.name: FIELDS OF FIRE
stratagems.legend: Armour and infantry work in concert, forming overlapping fields of fire against which neither cover nor heavy armour can protect.
stratagems.description:
WHEN: Your Shooting phase.

TARGET: One REGIMENT unit and one SQUADRON unit from your army that have not been selected to shoot this phase.

EFFECT: Select one enemy unit. Until the end of the phase, each time your selected REGIMENT and SQUADRON units make an attack that targets that enemy unit, improve the Armour Penetration characteristic of that attack by 1.

stratagems.name: SMOKESCREEN
stratagems.legend: Even the most skilled marksmen struggle to hit targets veiled by billowing screens of smoke.
stratagems.description:
WHEN: Your opponent’s Shooting phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.

TARGET: One SMOKE unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit’s attacks.

EFFECT: Until the end of the phase, all models in your unit have the Benefit of Cover and the Stealth ability.

detachmentAbilities.name: Born Soldiers
detachmentAbilities.legend: Regiments of numerous origins and tactical roles inculcate their soldiers from an early age with the legendary doctrines of the Tactica Imperium. Infantry train in close-range fire patterns intended to decimate enemy soldiers, whilst tank crews spend countless hours practising to bring down enemy armour and rampaging monstrosities.
detachmentAbilities.description:
Each time a model in a REGIMENT unit from your army makes a ranged attack that targets a visible unit (excluding MONSTERS and VEHICLES), that attack has the [LETHAL HITS] ability.

Each time a model in a SQUADRON unit from your army makes a ranged attack that targets a visible MONSTER or VEHICLE unit, that attack has the [LETHAL HITS] ability.

detachmentAbilities.name: Artillery Support
detachmentAbilities.legend: Artillery barrages lay the ground for the assault to come.
detachmentAbilities.description:
At the start of the battle round, select one of the following types of artillery support.
  • Creeping Barrage: Roll one D6 for each enemy unit that is more than 12" from every model from your army that is on the battlefield: On a 5+, until the end of the battle round, that unit is shaken. While a unit is shaken, subtract 2" from its Move characteristic and subtract 2 from Charge rolls made for it. The maximum number of units that can be shaken by this rule in each battle round depends on the battle size, as shown below.
  • Incendiary Bombardment: Select a number of enemy units more than 12" from every model from your army that is on the battlefield. Until the end of the battle round, those enemy units are scattered. While a unit is scattered, it cannot have the Benefit of Cover. The maximum number of units you can select in this way depends on the battle size, as shown below.
    • Smoke Shells: Select a number of units from your army. Until the end of the battle round, those units have the Stealth ability.

    BATTLE SIZEMAXIMUM NUMBER OF UNITSIncursion2Strike Force3Onslaught4

detachmentAbilities.name: Iron Tread
detachmentAbilities.legend: The armoured spearhead of an Astra Militarum army group grinds relentlessly forward, ploughing through enemy infantry with arrogant disregard.
detachmentAbilities.description: Each time a SQUADRON unit from your army Advances, do not make an Advance roll for it; until the end of the phase, add 6" to the Move characteristic of models in that unit, and when making that Advance move, that unit can move within Engagement Range of enemy models but cannot end that move within Engagement Range of enemy models.

datasheets.name: Leman Russ Battle Tank
datasheets.legend: The Leman Russ is the core battle tank of the Imperial Guard, forming the spearhead of countless armoured attacks. Those enemies that do not fall to the bombardment of their cannons and numerous hull-mounted guns are crushed mercilessly beneath their heavy treads.
datasheets.loadout: This model is equipped with: lascannon; Leman Russ battle cannon; armoured tracks.
datasheets.damagedDescription: While this model has 1-4 wounds remaining, each time this model makes an attack, subtract 1 from the Hit roll.

abilities.name: Deadly Demise
abilities.legend: From detonating ammo stores to corrosive innards or frenzied death throes, some targets are deadly even in defeat.
abilities.description:
From detonating ammo stores to corrosive innards or frenzied death throes, some targets are deadly even in defeat.Some models have ‘Deadly Demise x’ listed in their abilities. When such a model is destroyed, roll one D6 before removing it from play (if such a model is a TRANSPORT, roll before any embarked models disembark). On a 6, each unit within 6" of that model suffers a number of mortal wounds denoted by ‘x’ (if this is a random number, roll separately for each unit within 6").

Example: A TRANSPORT model with the Deadly Demise D3 ability is destroyed. Before any models disembark and before removing it from play, its controlling player rolls one D6, getting a 6. There are three units within 6" of that destroyed model, so its controlling player rolls one D3 for each of them, inflicting mortal wounds accordingly.
  • Deadly Demise x: When this model is destroyed, roll one D6. On a 6, each unit within 6" suffers ‘x’ mortal wounds.

stratagems.name: EXPLOSIVE CLEARANCE
stratagems.legend: A well-placed explosive munition in confined shipboard spaces can cause bloody carnage.
stratagems.description:
WHEN: Your Shooting phase.

TARGET: One unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot this phase.

EFFECT: Select one model in your unit that is equipped with a weapon with the [BLAST] ability. Until the end of the phase, when determining how many models are in the target unit for the purpose of that ability, include models that are not visible to the attacking model. In addition, attacks made with that weapon can be allocated to models that are not visible to the attacking model.

stratagems.name: COMMAND RE-ROLL
stratagems.legend: A great commander can bend even the vagaries of fate and fortune to their will, the better to ensure victory.
stratagems.description:
WHEN: Any phase, just after you make an Advance roll, a Charge roll, a Desperate Escape test or a Hazardous test for a unit from your army, or a Hit roll, a Wound roll, a Damage roll or a saving throw for a model in that unit, or a roll to determine the number of attacks made with a weapon equipped by a model in that unit. If you are using fast dice rolling, this Stratagem can still be used after rolling multiple rolls or saving throws at once.

TARGET: That unit or model from your army.

EFFECT: You re-roll that roll, test or saving throw. If you are using fast dice rolling, select one of those rolls or saving throws to re-roll.

stratagems.name: INSANE BRAVERY
stratagems.legend: Indifferent to their own survival, these warriors hold their ground against seemingly impossible odds.
stratagems.description:
WHEN: Battle-shock step of your Command phase, just after you have failed a Battle-shock test taken for a unit from your army.

TARGET: The unit from your army that Battle-shock test was just taken for (even though your Battle-shocked units cannot normally be affected by your Stratagems).

EFFECT: Your unit is treated as having passed that test instead, and is not Battle-shocked as a result.

stratagems.legend: Be it cunning strategy, potent technology or supernatural ritual, there are many means by which a commander may hasten their warriors’ onset.

RESTRICTIONS: You cannot use this Stratagem to enable a unit to arrive on the battlefield during a battle round it would not normally be able to do so in.

stratagems.name: COUNTER-OFFENSIVE
stratagems.legend: In close-quarters combat, the slightest hesitation can leave an opening for a swift foe to exploit.
stratagems.description:
WHEN: Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has fought.

TARGET: One unit from your army that is within Engagement Range of one or more enemy units and that has not already been selected to fight this phase.

EFFECT: Your unit fights next.

stratagems.name: COMMAND RE-ROLL
stratagems.legend: A great commander can bend even the vagaries of fate and fortune to their will, the better to ensure victory.
stratagems.description:
WHEN: Any phase, just after you have made a Hit roll, a Wound roll, a Damage roll, a saving throw, an Advance roll, a Charge roll, a Desperate Escape test, a Hazardous test, or just after you have rolled the dice to determine the number of attacks made with a weapon, for an attack, model or unit from your army.

TARGET: That unit or model from your army.

EFFECT: You re-roll that roll, test or saving throw.

stratagems.name: STALWART PROTECTOR
stratagems.legend: The indefatigable tanks of the Astra Militarum serve as mobile cover for the troops marching in their shadow.
stratagems.description:
WHEN: Your opponent’s Shooting phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.

TARGET: One ASTRA MILITARUM VEHICLE unit from your army.

EFFECT: Until the end of the phase, each time a ranged attack is allocated to an INFANTRY model from your army, if that model is not fully visible to every model in the attacking unit because of your VEHICLE, that model has the Benefit of Cover against that attack.

stratagems.name: ABLATIVE PLATING
stratagems.type: Hammer of the Emperor – Wargear Stratagem
stratagems.legend: Crews routinely reinforce their vehicle's armour, adding ablative plating, track links, sandbags and other means to protect the hull.
